checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of the shelf life of Vit A once it is opened and ensures it is not given after shelf life
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: 6-8 weeks. Check for if date of opening has been marked on the bottle.

checkpoint.name: Antipyretic drugs are available
Reconstituted vaccines are not used after recommended time
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check when the vaccine vials opened, reconstituted and valid for use. Should not be used beyond 4 hours after reconstitution

checkpoint.name: Check for injection site is not cleaned with sprit before administering vaccine dose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: cleaning the injection site with a spirit swab before vaccination is not advisable as live components of the vaccine are killed if they come in contact with spirit

checkpoint.name: Staff checks VVM level before using vaccines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff how to check VVM level and how to identify discard point. 4 stages - use up to 3 stage)

checkpoint.name: Mother & child protection card is available & updated
Counselling on adverse events and follow up visits done
Availability of separate box for open & reused vaccines
Staff is aware of how check freeze damage for T-Series vaccines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff to demonstrate how to conduct Shake test for DPT, DT and TT

checkpoint.name: Vaccine recipient is asked to stay for half an hour after vaccination to observer any adverse effect following immunization
Staff knows what to do in case of anaphylaxis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Immediate report to MO

checkpoint.name: Time of opening/ Reconstitution is recorded on the vial
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check on vial

checkpoint.name: Micro plan for respective area of ANM has been adequately prepared
ASHA prepares due list of immunization for her respective area
Check for DPT, DT, Hepatitis B, and TT vials are Kept in basket in upper section of ILR
Availability of diluents for Reconstitution of measles vaccine
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Match no. of dilutants With no. of measles

checkpoint.name: ANM/ASHA is aware of how to calculate the no. of Beneficiaries (pregnant women & Infants for every vaccination)
Tracking of missed out children done by ANM /ASHA
Primary Management & referral of chronic supportive otitis media (CSOM) as per guideline
Screening of chronic supportive otitis media (CSOM) Safe type/ unsafe type as per standard treatment guideline
Treatment of falciparum failure cases is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Falciparum malaria should be given alternative ACT or quinine with Doxycycline. Doxycycline is contraindicated in pregnancy, lactation and in children up to 8 years.

checkpoint.name: Treatment of uncomplicated P. falciparum Malaria in pregnancy is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Pregnant women with uncomplicated Falciparum should be treated 1st trimester: Quinine, 2nd &3rd trimester: ACT

checkpoint.name: Identification of drug resistance /failure cases especially falciparum is done as per protocols
Treatment of mixed infection is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Mixed infections with P. falciparum should be treated as falciparum malaria. However, antirelapse treatment with primaquine can be given for 14 days, if indicated.

checkpoint.name: Staff is trained to identify severe cases of malaria especially severe manifestation of P falciparum
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Severe malaria have one or more of following features: impaired consciousness/coma,Repeated generalized convulsions, Renal failure (Serum Creatinine >3 mg/dl), Jaundice (Serum Bilirubin >3 mg/dl), Severe anaemia (Hb <5 g/dl), Pulmonary oedema, Hypoglycaemia (Plasma Glucose <40 mg/dl), Circulatory collapse/shock, DIC, Hyperpyrexia,Hyperparasitaemia (>5% parasitized RBCs ), Haemoglobinuria etc.

checkpoint.name: Treatment for Confirmed P. falciparum is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: P. falciparum cases are treated with ACT (Artesunate 3days+Sulphadoxine- Pyrimethamine 1 day) This is accompanied by single dose of Pramaquine preferably day 2). However, there is resistance to partner drug SP in NE, it is recommended to use ARTEMETHER( 20 mg) - LUMEFANTRINE (120 mg (ACT-AL) as per age specific dose schedule for the treatment of pf cases in NE (contraindicated in 1st trimester of pregnancy & for children weighting <5 years)

checkpoint.name: Patient on malaria treatment (specially on Primaquine) are provided with information about when to report back
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patients should be instructed to report back in case of haematuria or high colored urine / cyanosis or blue coloration of lips and Primaquine should be stopped

checkpoint.name: Algorithm for treatment & diagnosis of malaria is available with treating physician
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of Alogrithm

checkpoint.name: Different coloured blister packs of ACT+SP is available for different age group especially for field staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: e.g: Pink for 0-1 year, yellow for 1-5 yrs, green for 5-8 yrs, Red for 9-14 yrs & white for 1 5& above. For NE: pack colour and regimen vary by body weight & age group, Yellow: weight for 5to 14 kg and age for> 5 month to <3 years, green: weight 15 to 24 kg age >3 to 8yrs, Red : weight 25-34 kg, age 9 to 14 yrs, white:weight > 34 kg,and age >14 yrs

checkpoint.name: Distribution of Chloroquine in endemic area
Treatment for confirmed P. Vivax Malaria is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
P.vivax cases should be treated with chloroquine for three days and Primaquine for 
14 days. Primaquine is used to prevent relapse but is contraindicated in pregnant 
women, infants and individuals with G6PD deficiency.

checkpoint.name: Protocols for treatment for TB during pregnancy and Post natal Period is adhered
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Discontinuation of Streptomycin
Chemoprophylaxis of baby in case of smear positive mother

checkpoint.name: What action is taken if patient misses DOT on 2 occasion in Intensive phase
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Arrange visit of MO- PHI to patient home for counseling of the patient.

checkpoint.name: Check What action is taken if patient misses DOT on 2 occasion in Intensive phase
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Arrange visit of MO- PHI to patient home for counselling of the patient.

checkpoint.name: Duplicate treatment card is issued to DOT provider/community DOT provider if DOT provider is situtated outside the healthcare centre
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Original card is maintained at healthcare centre where treatment has started

checkpoint.name: Follow up of smear examination for New smear positive patient is done as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 months of intensive phase. Follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 month of continution phase and finally at the end of treatment.

checkpoint.name: Medical officer issue Patient wise box (PWB) for entire duration for treatment to Peripheral Health worker/DOT provider
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the stock to be maintained

checkpoint.name: Follow up smear examination for smear negative patients as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Two smears are examined during the follow-up visit at the end of 2 months of the intensive phase and again at the end of treatment

checkpoint.name: Management of paediatric tuberculosis as per guidelines
Side effects of anti TB treatment is identified by DOT provider and reported to MO
Category wise treatment regimen is given to patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Category I- New sputum smear-positive
Seriously ill** new sputum smear-negative
Seriously ill** new extra-pulmonary- 2H3R3Z3E3+
4H3R3, Category II- Sputum smear-positive Relapse
Sputum smear-positive Failure
Sputum smear-positive Treatment After Default
Others***- 2H3R3Z3E3S3 +
1H3R3Z3E3 +
5H3R3E3,

checkpoint.name: DOT directory is maintained &updated at healthcare facility level
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: DOT directory For identify suitable DOT provider & DOT centre

checkpoint.name: ASHA/ ANM are aware for monitoring of TB Patients and adherence to DOT treatment
Medical officer also discuss about near by DOT centre with the patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Easily accessible and acceptable by patient, Place identified for DOT (DOT centre) & name and designation of DOT provider is written in patient treatment card

checkpoint.name: Original treatment card is updated at regular intervals by PHW
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Fortnightly Basis

checkpoint.name: Management of Extra pulmonary tuberculosis as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Diagnostic algorithm for TB lymphadenitis

checkpoint.name: Check What action taken by DOT provider if they fail to retrieve such patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Reported to next level supervisor (PHW/MO- PHI/STS/ MO-TB)

checkpoint.name: Patient wise box are colour coded as per category
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Red - Category I, Blue -Category -II,

checkpoint.name: Follow up smear examination for re -treatment patients as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 3 months of intensive phase. Follow up sputum examination is done at the end of 2 month of continution phase and finally at the end of treatment.

checkpoint.name: What action is taken by DOT provider (ASHA/ANM) if they fail to retrieve such patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Reported to next level supervisor (PHW/MO- PHI/STS/ MO-TB)

checkpoint.name: Prior to start of treatment patient identity card & and treatment card is prepared
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Address of the patient is verified by Peripheral Health worker before start of the treatment Within 1 week of diagnosis

checkpoint.name: In continuous phase doses is taken as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: First dose in taken under supervision of DOT provider/Community DOT provider and for subsequent doses for week is self administrated. Empty blisters are contacted within next scheduled visit

checkpoint.name: All the doses of intensive phase is taken as per guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Under supervision of DOT provider/Community DOT provider if any dose is missed patient must be contacted within 1 day and dose is administrated on following day

Side effects of anti TB treatment is identified by DOT provider and reported to MO

checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Rapid Kit test done for suspected cases & if case found positive, referred to ICTC

Laboratory has system to retain the copies of reported result and could be promptly retrieved when required
Laboratory has defined retention period and disposal of used sample
Laboratory has format for reporting of results
Laboratory has system to provide the reports within defined time intervals
Staining & examination of blood films is done as per protocols
Staff is aware of method of prepartion of blood flims
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Select 2 0r 3 finger,site of puncture is site of ball of finger, hold the slide by its edges, the size of blood drop is controlled better if finger touches the slide,touch the drop of blood with clean slide, take 3 drops for thick smear, touch the another new drop of blood with edge of clean slide,spread the blood with corner of another slide to make circle, bring edge of slide carryingsecod drop of blood to surface of first slide, wait till blood spread whole edge, holding it an angle of 450 push it forward

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of methodolgy for estimation of parasite density
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For thick smear staff is aware of parasite per microlitre & pluse sytsem

checkpoint.name: Preparation of Malaria Slides as per protocols
Laboratory has system in place to label the primary sample
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check how slides/test tubes/vials are marked (Permanent Glass Marker is available)

checkpoint.name: Laboratory has system to trace the primary sample from requisition form
Laboratory has system in place to monitor the transportation of the sample to higher centre
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Transportation of sample includes: Time frame, temperature and carrier specified for transportation

checkpoint.name: Instructions for collection and handling of primary sample are communicated to those responsible for collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Instructions are given to ASHA/ANM/MPW for collection of samples (Peripheral smear, sputum, water sample)

checkpoint.name: Requisition of all laboratory test is done in request form
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Request form contain information: Name and identification number of patient, name of authorized requester, type of primary sample, examination requested, date and time of primary sample collection and date and time of receipt of sample by laboratory,

checkpoint.name: Laboratory staff is aware of methodology for smear preparation & staining slides
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ziel Neelsen /(1% Carbol fuchsion, 25% Sulphuric Acid, 0.1% Methylene blue). If Laboratory is not designated DMC, give full compliance

checkpoint.name: Laboratory staff follow guideline for collecting sputum for smear microscopy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Two sample will be collected: Early morning-Spot

checkpoint.name: Laboratory staff/ health worker provide guidence to patient for sputum collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Explains steps of collecting sputum

checkpoint.name: Medical Practioner fills standardized laboratory form for sputum examination
Staff is aware of how to examine and interpretation sputum smear
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If Laboratory is not designated DMC, give full compliance

checkpoint.name: Instruction for Ziel Neelsen Staining procedure &interpretation chart are displayed at working station
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If Laboratory is not designated DMC, give full compliance

checkpoint.name: Laboratory has Biological reference interval for its examination of various results

Primary management of emergency signs newborns
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Check for adherence to clinical protocols . The management of emergency signs consist of –Resuscitation
-Management of Hypoglycemia
-Management of Hypothermia
-Management of shock

checkpoint.name: ASHA is skilled for home based management of Hypothermia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: If temperature is <97F then advice the mother to keep the baby warm through increasing room temperature and providing skin to skin contact

checkpoint.name: ASHA is skilled for Identifying danger signs and referral for Newborn
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Weight <1.8 kg
Temperature > 99 degree 
Yellowness in eyes/Skin persistent for more than 14 day after birth.

checkpoint.name: Primary management of children with fever, cough & breathlessness
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for adherence to clinical protocols .Check facility of nebulization, oxygen & mask

checkpoint.name: Screening of children coming to OPDs using weight for height and/or MUAC

Treatment of Dysentery as per protocol
Treatment of Persistent Diarrheal as per clinical protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Single Dose-Vit A
Zinc Sulphate 20 mg daily for 14 Days 
Follow up in 5 days &feeding of children

checkpoint.name: ORS therapy is provided as per guidelines during Outreach Sessions
Staff aware & Practice ETAT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff is skilled for basic life support for young, infant & children

checkpoint.name: Treatment of diarrheal with no dehydration
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Give fluids, zinc supplements and food and advise to continue ORS at home 
• Advise mother when to return immediately.·
• Follow up in 5 days if not improving.
